page.title: 04Ballywalter-Flax Farming
page.content: A farmer outside Ballywalter last year grew 25 acres of flax for linen making.This year he has 50 acres.We ,in Nothern Ireland,started growing flax again two years ago.Lastyear we grew 500 acres and this year we are growing 1000 acres. We started growing flax here because we found a new way of retting it before it is made into yarn. Northern Ireland has a good climate for growing flax and there have always been flax spinning companies. We used to grow flax but stopped in 1949.Most of it was grown during the two world wars as much of the cloth was used by the army for clothing. The linen was also used for the wings of aeroplanes.Now it is very popular for making clothes.
